峽峽RS
峡峡		gorge, ravine
  • wedged 夾/夹 between the mountains 山
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 峡)
Ideographic: The space between 夾 two mountains 山; 夾 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples: 峽谷 [ xiá gǔ ]: canyon; gill; ravine
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
    • 夾 [ jiā ] to support; to be wedged between
heisig_chinese_memo: At the beach playing in the sand you first dig out a gorge, and then press from both sides the sand to fill it back in and make a mountain.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A gorge is where God has cut into a mountain with a pair of scissors.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " mountain " and " clamping ", the original meaning is the place where two mountains and water are caught. "Selected Works‧ Zuo Si "Shu Du Fu"": "Through the Three Gorges, it is the surpassing of the five indica." Liu Kui's note: "The Three Gorges, Badong Yongan County, there are mountains opposite each other, and the relative distance can be about 20 meters, cliff It’s so high, it’s called a gorge, and the river flows through it."

" Gap " also refers to between two mountains. "Huainanzi-Yuan Daoxun": "Happy in Guangze, and imitating the ocean beside the mountain gorge." Gao You's note: "Between the two mountains is a gorge." One book is " Cape ".

" Gap " can mean narrow. The Northern Wei Dynasty Li Daoyuan's "Water Classics-River Water IV": "Like the east from the north, it is known as the Hangu Pass. The sky is high on the shore, the valley is deep, the gorge of the stream, the car does not have square tracks, and the name is natural danger. "

" Gorge " also specifically refers to the Three Gorges of the Yangtze River. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Speaking of New Words-Words": "Huan Gong enters the gorge, the cliff is suspended in the sky, and the waves are fast."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " mountain ", " clamping ", the original meaning is the place where two mountains are caught by water.
humanum_full_description:
從「山」，「夾」聲，本義為兩山夾水處。《文選‧左思〈蜀都賦〉》：「經三峽之崢嶸，躡五屼之蹇滻。」劉逵注：「三峽，巴東永安縣，有高山相對，相去可二十丈左右，崖甚高，人謂之峽，江水過其中。」

　　「峽」也指兩山之間。《淮南子‧原道訓》：「逍遙于廣澤之中，而仿洋于山峽之旁。」高誘注：「兩山之間為峽。」一本作「岬」。

　　「峽」可表示狹窄。北魏酈道元《水經注‧河水四》：「歷北出東崤，通謂之函谷關也。邃岸天高，空谷幽深，澗道之峽，車不方軌，號曰天險。」

　　「峽」還特指長江三峽。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧言語》：「桓公入峽，絕壁天懸，騰波迅急。」
humanum_short_description: 從「山」，「夾」聲，本義為兩山夾水處。

峽峽RS
峡峡 		gorge, ravine
  • wedged 夾/夹 between the mountains 山
(Simplified: 峡)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: The space between 夾 two mountains 山; 夾 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
    • 夾 [ jiā ] to support; to be wedged between
①兩山夾着的水道：三門峽(中國黃河中游峽谷之一)。三峽(中國長江流經四川到湖北的交界一帶所經過的三個峽谷，其中有“瞿塘峽”、“巫峽”、“西陵峽”)。海峽(兩旁有陸地夾着的形狀狹長的海，如“臺灣峽峽”)。
②指兩山之間：峽谷(狹而深的谷地)。
峽谷 [ xiá gǔ ]: canyon; gill; ravine
(Simplified: 峡)

從「 山 」，「 夾 」聲，本義為兩山夾水處。《文選‧左思〈蜀都賦〉》：「經三峽之崢嶸，躡五屼之蹇滻。」劉逵注：「三峽，巴東永安縣，有高山相對，相去可二十丈左右，崖甚高，人謂之峽，江水過其中。」 「 峽 」也指兩山之間。《淮南子‧原道訓》：「逍遙于廣澤之中，而仿洋于山峽之旁。」高誘注：「兩山之間為峽。」一本作「 岬 」。 「 峽 」可表示狹窄。北魏酈道元《水經注‧河水四》：「歷北出東崤，通謂之函谷關也。邃岸天高，空谷幽深，澗道之峽，車不方軌，號曰天險。」 「 峽 」還特指長江三峽。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧言語》：「桓公入峽，絕壁天懸，騰波迅急。」
From the sound of " mountain" and " clamping", the original meaning is the place where two mountains and water are caught. "Selected Works‧ Zuo Si "Shu Du Fu"": "Through the Three Gorges, it is the surpassing of the five indica." Liu Kui's note: "The Three Gorges, Badong Yongan County, there are mountains opposite each other, and the relative distance can be about 20 meters, cliff It’s so high, it’s called a gorge, and the river flows through it." " Gap" also refers to between two mountains. "Huainanzi-Yuan Daoxun": "Happy in Guangze, and imitating the ocean beside the mountain gorge." Gao You's note: "Between the two mountains is a gorge." One book is " Cape". " Gap" can mean narrow. The Northern Wei Dynasty Li Daoyuan's "Water Classics-River Water IV": "Like the east from the north, it is known as the Hangu Pass. The sky is high on the shore, the valley is deep, the gorge of the stream, the car does not have square tracks, and the name is natural danger. " " Gorge" also specifically refers to the Three Gorges of the Yangtze River. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Speaking of New Words-Words": "Huan Gong enters the gorge, the cliff is suspended in the sky, and the waves are fast."

Liushutong characters (3)

峽字的基本解释

峽
xiá
见“峡”。

峽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiá］
［《廣韻》侯夾切，入洽，匣。］
“峡1”的繁体字。
(1)两山夹水处。
(2)指两山之间。
(3)狭窄。
(4)特指长江三峡。

峽字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　峽； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页312第18
【廣韻】侯夾切【集韻】【韻會】轄夾切【正韻】胡夾切，?音洽。【廣韻】巫峽，山名。蜀楚之交，山有三峽。【左思·蜀都賦】經三峽之崢嶸。【註】三峽在巴東永安縣，謂西陵峽，歸鄕峽，巫峽也。【盛弘之荆州記】三峽七百里中，兩岸連山無斷處，重巖疊嶂，隱天蔽日，非亭午不見日月。　又州名。秦將白起攻楚，燒夷陵，卽其地。魏武於此置臨江郡。後魏爲拓州，取開拓之義。周以其居三峽之口，因曰峽州。　又山峭夾水，亦曰峽。見前岬字註。　【集韻】本作陜。或作陿。

峽字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
峽字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiá］
["Guang Yun" Hou clip cut, enter into contact, box. ]
Traditional characters for "峡1".
(1) The place between the two mountains and the water.
(2) Refers to between two mountains.
(3) Narrowness.
(4) Especially referring to the Three Gorges of the Yangtze River.
gorge
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Word Department] 　 Gorge; Kangxi strokes: 10; Page number: page 312 18
[Guang Yun] Hou Jiaqie [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] Jurisdiction Jiaqie [Zheng Yun] Hu Jiaqie,? Yin Qia. [Guangyun] Wu Gorge, the name of the mountain. At the turn of Shu and Chu, the mountains had the Three Gorges. [Zuo Si·Fu of the Capital of Shu] Zhenrong by the Three Gorges. [Note] The Three Gorges is located in Yong'an County, Badong. It is called Xiling Gorge, Guiyang Gorge, and Wu Gorge. [Shenghong's Jingzhou] In the seven hundred miles of the Three Gorges, there is no break between the two sides of the mountain, the heavy rocks are stacked, the sky is hidden, and the sun and the moon are not visible at noon.　Also the name of the state. Qin Jiang Bai attacked Chu and burned Yiling tombs. Wei Wu set Linjiang County here. Later Wei was Tuozhou, taking the meaning of pioneering. Zhou called it Xiazhou because it lived at the mouth of the Three Gorges.　There are mountains and cliffs and water, and it is called the gorge. See note for the words before the cape.　【Jiyun】This is Shaan. Or Zuo Kou.
